intro: Hedyotis volubilis, commonly known as the climbing gardenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial vine characterized by its trailing or climbing habit and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are usually opposite and covered in fine hairs. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Hedyotis volubilis is also known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments and its use in traditional medicine.
